title: Criterion 1
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately identifies the culture in which the architectural complex shown was constructed.
descriptions: Accurately identifies the culture in which the architectural complex shown was constructed.

title: Criterion 2
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Completely identifies the architectural complex in the required course content that was constructed within the same culture.

Identifying a work of art includes title or designation, culture of origin, date of creation, and materials. At least two accurate identifiers must be given for the point to be earned.
descriptions:
Completely identifies the architectural complex in the required course content that was constructed within the same culture.

Identifying a work of art includes title or designation, culture of origin, date of creation, and materials. At least two accurate identifiers must be given for the point to be earned.

title: Criterion 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately justifies the attribution by comparing the two complexes, using specific visual evidence.
descriptions: Accurately justifies the attribution by comparing the two complexes, using specific visual evidence.

title: Criterion 4
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately uses specific visual evidence to analyze how both complexes communicate a sense of power.
descriptions: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to analyze how both complexes communicate a sense of power.

title: Criterion 5
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately uses specific contextual evidence to analyze how both complexes communicate a sense of power.
descriptions: Accurately uses specific contextual evidence to analyze how both complexes communicate a sense of power.
